intro: Palicourea rigida var. aurata, commonly known as golden palicourea, is a flowering plant native to tropical regions of South America. It belongs to the Rubiaceae family, which includes many species with showy flowers and aromatic leaves. The plant is characterized by its slender, woody stems and opposite, ovate leaves with a glossy, dark green surface. Its flowers are small, clustered in inflorescences, and often have a yellow or golden hue, giving it its common name. It is sometimes cultivated for its ornamental value and has been used in traditional medicine for various purposes.
